question: Which of the following structures is NOT derived from mesoderm?
exp: Suprarenal medulla develops from neural crest cells. Axial mesoderm - notochord - nucleus pulposus of interveebral disc. Para - axial mesoderm - somites - skeletal muscles. Intermediate mesoderm - genitourinary system - kidney, testis, ovary. Lateral mesoderm - cardiac & smooth muscles.

question: Uncinate process of ethmoid bone is attached anteriorly to the bone?
exp: Ethmoid bone is a pneumatic bone & contains ethmoid air cells, superior & middle turbinates. Ethmoid bone forms medial wall of orbit. Orbit wall Bone Medial Ethmoid bone Roof Frontal bone Lateral Zygomatic bone Floor Maxilla Uncinate process is a pa of ethmoid bone, coming from middle turbinate. Attachments: Anterior - Lacrimal bone & frontonasal process of maxilla Posterior - Free but related to perpendicular plate of palatine bone. Inferiorly - Inferior turbinate.

question: Rectus sheath is contributed by?
exp: The rectus sheath, also called the rectus fascia, is formed by the aponeurosis of the transverse abdominus and the internal and external oblique muscle. It contains the rectus abdominis and pyramidalis muscles.
opb: Internal oblique and transversus abdominis aponeurosis
opc: External, internal oblique and transversus abdominis aponeurosis
opd: Aponeurosis of Internal oblique and transverse abdominis & fascia transversalis

question: Upper covering layer of cochlear duct is
exp: Reissner's membrane - between Scala vestibuli & Scala media. Basilar membrane - between scala media & Scala tympani Tectorial membrane - covers the hair cells. Stria vascularis gives the endolymph which is ultrafiltrate of blood.

question: Primitive streak develops from?
exp: Around day 14, the epiblast cells form primitive streak,. Notochord is formed by the mesoderm cells developed by epiblast cells.
